intro: Chromolaena misella, commonly known as the Hawaiian tridacna, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its robust, woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typically visited by various pollinators. Chromolaena misella is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. It is considered an invasive species in some regions due to its rapid growth and competitive nature.
